Public.EditorialNote: I think this may be the same as Open / open source...
Public.Definition: No license has been specified but resource is designated as "Public". Because a license is not explicitly indicated, an implicit copyright is declared without explaining how others could use the code / resource. Since the code / resource is unlicensed, owners could theoretically assert copyright at any time and demand that people stop using the code / resource. (Adapted from the Coding Horror Blog by Jeff Atwood)
